featured.text: When the kernels start 38 , shake the pot to let the steam escape and to let the unpopped kernels fall to the bottom.
Then, in about 30 minutes after the cutting began, the giant tree crashed down violently and shook the ground under our feet.
(31) I was walking to the beach, a stranger came up to me and tried to shake my hand.
“Adam Joshua!” yelled Nelson, pushing away a basketball and shaking a toy frog off his foot.

definition.en_def: To move or cause to move up and down or from side to side with rapid, forceful movements.
definition.example: She decided to shake the bottle before pouring the drink.
